name: National Gallery
description: A national museum holding the world’s largest public collection of Singaporean and Southeast Asian art, with a focus on Singapore’s culture and heritage in relation to other Asian cultures and the world.

name: The Substation
description: Singapore’s first independent contemporary arts centre, known for its experimental programming, exhibitions, and initiatives that lead and support cultural conversation.

name: Basheer Graphic Book
description: A specialty bookstore where you can find design books and magazines about architecture, interior design, landscape design, graphic design, animation, fashion, typography, and photography.

name: Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay
description: Singapore’s premier arts centre for local and international performing arts including dance, music, and theatre. Free performances and visual art exhibitions almost daily.

name: Asian Film Archive
description: A creative hub for the Asian film community, promoting the widespread critical appreciation of film as an art form. Hosts an array of screenings along with cultural and educational film-related programmes.
address: Level 4, National Library Building, 100 Victoria Street, Singapore 188064
opening hours: OFFICE HOURS Mon–Fri: 10am–6pm Closed on Saturday & Sunday

name: The Moon
description: A diverse cafe and bookstore specially curated to address historical gender imbalances in Anglophone publishing, with a focus on writers and artists of colour. Hosts wellness workshops, an LGBTQ+ book club, and pop-ups regularly.

name: STPI – Creative Workshop & Gallery
description: A cutting-edge gallery showcasing artistic experimentation through the mediums of print and paper. Holds a variety of dialogues, screenings, workshops, and guided tours.
opening hours: Mon–Fri: 10am–7pm; Sat: 9am–6pm; Sun: 10am–5pm Closed on Public Holidays

name: DECK
description: An independent photo exhibition space for photography enthusiasts, constructed within 19 shipping containers to save space in our small city.

name: ArtScience Museum
description: A futuristic museum with an ever-changing line-up of international exhibitions that push the boundaries of science, art, and technology.

name: Atlas Bar
description: The go-to gin and champagne bar for a quintessential 1920s Art Deco experience—the paragon of Jazz age elegance, complete with glamorous interiors.
address: 600 North Bridge Road, Parkview Square, Singapore 188778
opening hours: Mon–Thu: 10am–1am; Fri: 10am–2am; Sat: 3pm–2am Closed on Sundays

name: The Parkview Museum
description: A stronghold for contemporary art that alternates between solo shows, thematic exhibitions, and special exhibitions from local and international contemporary artists.
address: 600 North Bridge Road, Parkview Square Level 3, Singapore 188778

name: Huggs-Epigram Coffee Bookshop
description: The only bookshop-cum-café offering locally-themed books that are about Singapore, written by Singaporeans, or published by Singaporean publishers. PS: get your fix of Singapore-style coffee here!
opening hours: HUGGS COFFEE Mon–Fri: 7am–5pm; Sat: 10am–2pm EPIGRAM BOOKSHOP Mon–Fri: 10am–7pm; Sat: 10am–2pm Closed on Sundays

name: The Projector
description: Singapore’s most renowned independent arthouse cinema screens a mix of local films, indie selections, and cult classics in an atmospheric theatre restored from the 70s.
address: 6001 Beach Road, Golden Mile Tower #05-00, Singapore 199589
